verses.verse: Thus says the LORD: (Is. 15:1-16; Jer. 25:21; Ezek. 25:8-11; Zeph. 2:8-11) “For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because he (2 Kin. 3:26, 27) burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime.
But I will send a fire upon Moab, And it shall devour the palaces of (Jer. 48:24, 41) Kerioth; Moab shall die with tumult, With shouting and trumpet sound.
And I will cut off (Num. 24:17; Jer. 48:7) the judge from its midst, And slay all its princes with him,” Says the LORD.

(Judgment on Judah) Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (2 Kin. 17:19; Hos. 12:2; Amos 3:2) Judah, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, (Lev. 26:14) Because they have despised the law of the LORD, And have not kept His commandments. (Is. 9:15, 16; 28:15; Jer. 16:19; Hab. 2:18) Their lies lead them astray, Lies (Jer. 9:14; 16:11, 12; Ezek. 20:13, 16, 18) which their fathers followed.
(Jer. 17:27; Hos. 8:14) But I will send a fire upon Judah, And it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”

(Judgment on Israel) Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of (Judg. 2:17-20; 2 Kin. 17:7-18; 18:12; Ezek. 22:1-13, 23-29) Israel, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because (Is. 29:21) they sell the righteous for silver, And the (Joel 3:3; Amos 4:1; 5:11; 8:6; Mic. 2:2; 3:3) poor for a pair of sandals.

They pant after the dust of the earth which is on the head of the poor, And (Amos 5:12) pervert the way of the humble. (Lev. 18:6-8; Ezek. 22:11) A man and his father go in to the same girl, (Lev. 20:3; Ezek. 36:20-22) To defile My holy name.
They lie down (1 Cor. 8:10) by every altar on clothes (Ex. 22:26) taken in pledge, And drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.

“Yet it was I who destroyed the (Gen. 15:16; Num. 21:25; Deut. 2:31; Josh. 10:12) Amorite before them, Whose height was like the (Ezek. 31:3) height of the cedars, And he was as strong as the oaks; Yet I (Is. 5:24; Ezek. 17:9; (Mal. 4:1)) destroyed his fruit above And his roots beneath.
Also it was (Ex. 12:51; Amos 3:1; 9:7) I who brought you up from the land of Egypt, And (Deut. 2:7) led you forty years through the wilderness, To possess the land of the Amorite.
I raised up some of your sons as (Num. 12:6) prophets, And some of your young men as (Num. 6:2, 3; Judg. 13:5) Nazirites. Is it not so, O you children of Israel?” Says the LORD.
“But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And commanded the prophets (Is. 30:10; Jer. 11:21; Amos 7:13, 16; Mic. 2:6) saying, ‘Do not prophesy!’
“Behold, (Is. 1:14) I am weighed down by you, As a cart full of sheaves is weighed down.
(Jer. 46:6) Therefore flight shall perish from the swift, The strong shall not strengthen his power, (Ps. 33:16; Jer. 9:23) Nor shall the mighty deliver himself;
He shall not stand who handles the bow, The swift of foot shall not escape, Nor shall he who rides a horse deliver himself.
The most courageous men of might Shall flee naked in that day,” Says the LORD.
